attributes.action: Review NHS Blood Donor exclusions to ensure they are not discriminatory (any)
attributes.additional_details:
The HSE confirms that transmission of Hep-B is most commonly attributed to needle sharing rather than sexual orientation or habits.

"In England and Wales, injecting drugs is the most frequently reported route of infection."

http://www.hse.gov.uk/biosafety/blood-borne-viruses/hepatitis-b.htm
attributes.background:
The NHS Blood Transfusion Service discriminates against donors who;

> "If you are a man who in the last 12 months has had oral or anal sex with another man
> (If you are a woman) a man who has ever had oral or anal sex with another man"

Among other areas
